famous quote:
"This is one of the miracles of love: It gives a power of seeing through its own enchantments and yet not being disenchanted."
-- C.S. Lewis (A Grief Observed)
Interview Text:
Martin:

(part 2)

Now, the most important part of how the Lord speaks to me.

If you read a little earlier in 1 Kings, you realize Elijah is crying out to God. He is praying. He has gotten scared, depressed, basically overwhelmed, and feels desperate. God tells him to go to the mountain.

Get by yourself.
God tells him to wait and he will pass by.
Wait for the Lord to visit.
 
When I do the following:
 
Get up early before everyone else.
Go sit on the porch or by the fire.
Read the Bible.
Pray for an extended period.
                        I write out my prayers
                                    Praise
                                    Confess
                                    Thanks
                                    Request
 
It is amazing what the Lord tells me. It is rarely audible, but it is, in new and different ideas. Things I would have never thought of. Ideas that could only have come from God. This is how the Lord speaks to me. When I need the Lord to tell me what to do, this is the way I get help.
Music Video Instructions: Imagine if God's love for us, and ours for him was like this.
